720444f-a.title: Manhattan: Horatio Street - 8th Avenue
720444f-a.text:
16, 14, 10-8 Horatio Street, south side, east of and from Eighth
Avenue. No. 10-8 is the Chapel of the Comforter (Protestant Episcopal).
May 27, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720451f-b.title: Manhattan: Horatio Street - 8th Avenue
720451f-b.text:
Horatio Strcet, east from Eighth, to and including Greenwich Aves.
Also shorn (across J.ckson Square), are Nos. 253-237 Wost 13th Street, north
side, east of Greenwich Ave. Prominent building (No. 253), is a power
house for the Municipal Eighth Ave. Subway. Adjoining same, is the Jackson
Square Branch of the Hew York Public Library.
June 20, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720445f-a.title: Manhattan: Horatio Street - 8th Avenue
720445f-a.text:
16-18 Horatio Street, at and adjoining the 3.E. corner of Eighth Av). )
Also shown is 56-60 Eighth Ave., at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner ]
of Horatio Street. The corner building ''Vetts Hotel'', bears Nos. 18 Horatio,]
and 60 Eighth Ave.
March 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

710053f-a.title: Manhattan: 8th Avenue - Horatio Street
710053f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, south from Horatio Street, showing mainly the
easterly side of same. The photographer is viewing towerds Abingdon
Square where the dominant 16-story apartmant house appears. This
bears No. 20 Abingdon Square and is at the S. E. corner of W. 12th
Street.
Returning to the foregrounc one observes the diagonal sweep of
W. 4th Street across the Avenue, fhis is on right and running to the
left center. This leaves a triangular block in the center, the apex
of which touches upon Jane Street. The latter, though not seen, runs
in a horizontal plane across the midground and is obstructed from view
by the buildinggs at the right and left.
April 9, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODICTION8
